pair.Prompt: What is the case of Minnesota v. Northern Securities Co.?
pair.Response: Response: Minnesota v. Northern Securities Co. is a case in which the State of Minnesota sued the Northern Securities Company for violating the Anti-Trust Act of 1887. The Supreme Court held that the Circuit Court had jurisdiction to hear the case, as the Anti-Trust Act was for the benefit of all the States and all the people. The Court also noted that the State of Minnesota was the owner of more than three million acres of land, of the value of more than fifteen millions of dollars, obtained by donation from the United States. The date of the opinion was October Term, 1903. The case number was 194 U.S.
